revised_title: Strategies for Controlling Migrant Pest Populations: The Case of Desert Locust Plague Up surges
tldr: This article discusses the characteristics of Desert Locust plague upsurges and the strategies needed for their control. It highlights the importance of monitoring and controlling populations in breeding areas, as well as understanding the differences between solitarious and gregarious phases of locusts. The authors also provide examples of how outbreaks and plague upsurges develop and how they can be prevented.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Ecology and Population Dynamics
